channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Topologies on abelian groups and a topological five-lemma
item.description: arXiv:2502.20559v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this article we establish some results that involve topologizing exact sequences of abelian groups and derive, in particular, a new topological version of the classical Five-Lemma. These results will be applied in a forthcoming paper to generalizing Lichtenbaum-van Hamel's duality \cite{vH04} to (proper) singular varieties over a $p$-adic field. In such a topological-arithmetical context Pontryagin duality plays a central role and it becomes necessary to topologize hypercohomology groups of complexes of abelian sheaves so that certain long exact sequences of abelian groups become strict exact, i.e., exact in a topological sense.
item.dc:creator: Felipe Rivera-Mesas

item.title: A note on uniform continuity of monotone functions
item.description: arXiv:2502.20887v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove that it is consistent with ZFC that for every non-decreasing function $f:[0,1]\to [0,1]$, each subset of $[0,1]$ of cardinality $\mathfrak c$ contains a set of cardinality $\mathfrak c$ on which $f$ is uniformly continuous. We show that this statement follows from the assumptions that $\mathfrak d^* < \mathfrak c$ and $\mathfrak c$ is regular, where $\mathfrak d^*\leq \mathfrak d$ is the smallest cardinality $\kappa$ such that any two disjoint countable dense sets in the Cantor set can be separated by sets each of which is an intersection of at most $\kappa$-many open sets in the Cantor set. We establish also that $\mathfrak d^*=\min\{\mathfrak u, \mathfrak d\}=\min\{\mathfrak r, \mathfrak d\}$, thus giving an alternative proof of the latter equality established by J. Aubrey in 2004.
item.dc:creator: Roman Pol, Piotr Zakrzewski, Lyubomyr Zdomskyy
